There are several initiatives being implemented to combat plastic waste in the oceans around Australia:

1. The Australian Federal Government has committed to banning all single-use plastics by 2025. This includes items such as plastic straws, cutlery, and plates.

2. The Australian Government has also established a $100 million fund to develop innovative solutions to reduce plastic waste and support new recycling technologies.

3. In March 2019, the Australian Capital Territory (ACT) became the first Australian jurisdiction to ban single-use plastics including straws, cutlery, and stirrers.

4. Many supermarkets across Australia are phasing out the use of single-use plastic bags and encouraging customers to use reusable bags.

5. Organizations such as Sea Shepherd, a non-profit marine wildlife conservation organization, conduct regular beach cleanups around Australia to remove plastic and other marine debris from the coastline.

6. The Greenpeace Australia Pacific organization runs campaigns to raise awareness about the impact of plastic pollution on marine life and encourages people to reduce their plastic consumption.
